During the Civil War Frederick Spielass worked as an enlistment officer and encouraged President Lincoln to make Emancipation an issue in the Civil War. Following the war Spielass would work for the Freedman's Bureau, the Freedman Bank and hold various government appointments including minister to Haiti and US marshal for the District of Columbia. 

Our intention is to offer to only those interested. If not the mechanizim is in place for you to decide.
